intro: Impatiens baumannii, commonly known as the white impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the genus Impatiens in the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and vibrant flower colors. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a unique bilabiate structure that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The蒴果 (capsule) matures into a three-lobed structure that explosively disperses its seeds when disturbed.
